channel.title: Pb
channel.description: so peanut butter is really something isnt it? + powerbot, is it clean yet? the official dl off of the website? i wana bot like a mad man and I wana know.

item.title: Pb
item.dc:creator: @moparisthebest Moparisthebest
item.description:
@moparisthebest wrote:

You can protect yourself by only running open source code you compile yourself, that is all you can do.

Read full topic

item.title: Pb
item.dc:creator: @Svitkona Svitkona
item.description:
@Svitkona wrote:

The story is, Paris and Jacmob had a disagreement about rsbot. They wanted to sell it for money or something, but Jacmob didn’t want that so he went to RSbuddy with Arbiter. Both sites were DDoSed soon after. Supposedly, before he left, Arbiter uploaded an infected rsbot that stole your passwords - if they were stored in the bot. Versions 2.22-2.24 were all infected before the mods caught on, after the mass hackings of botters when free trade returned.

Of course, Arbiter posted proof of another hacker by the name of “Gh0$t” from hackforums, who supposedly got his hands on an admin password and was able to infect it. A picture was posted as proof, but I don’t really know who to trust. I botted a bit on powerbot, wasn’t hacked or anything, but just remember not to save your account username and password. It’s how scripts can get your info, and how accounts were hacked in the first place.

Read full topic

item.title: Pb
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

[quote=“reyx7, post:11, topic:382871”]I used a mouse recorder to cook get the actions to cook 1000 lobs.
Technically a homemade bot?[/quote]
I remember when auto-clickers and recorders where the rage of RS botting.
Now they have all the full detail, do everything bots.

Read full topic

item.title: Pb
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

No, from what I heard was that a few of the updated RSBot links contained RSBots that stole the username, password, bankpin if the user saved it within the client, which is a bad idea in general.

Read full topic

item.title: Pb
item.dc:creator: @NewbieNewty Newty
item.description:
@NewbieNewty wrote:

To the best of my knowledge powerbot wasn’t infected. Just a few (many) scripts that had malicious code. Those scripts were all user made and I very much doubt the rsbot admins had anything to do with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Pb
item.dc:creator: @iCreatedHorror Ryan
item.description:
@iCreatedHorror wrote:

Eh, I use scripts that I have seen to have tons of users. I don’t download those new scripts until I see a ton of good comments. Besides, I only bot PC

item.title: Pb
item.dc:creator: @Ix_Soulcist_xI Soulcist
item.description:
@Ix_Soulcist_xI wrote:

As far as I can tell, Powerbot is running normal as the website and stuff should be. Though, I’ve heard a lot of complaints about Powerbot hacking into RuneScape accounts, or that was Rsbot (thought they where the same, whatever). So I would choose kind of careful on the bot you end up choosing.
